Package example

Class BasicCalloutServer

java.lang.Object
service.ServiceCallout
example.BasicCalloutServer
public class BasicCalloutServer extends ServiceCallout
Example callout server for processing HTTP headers and bodies.

This class handles several callout events and demonstrates how to mutate headers and bodies in both requests and responses. It provides a basic implementation for:

  • Request headers: Adds specific headers and clears the route cache.
  • Response headers: Adds and removes specific headers without clearing the route cache.
  • Request body: Appends content to the body.
  • Response body: Replaces the body with a predefined value.

  • Method Details

    • onRequestHeaders

      public void onRequestHeaders(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.ProcessingResponse.Builder processingResponseBuilder, io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HttpHeaders headers)
      Modifies the incoming request headers by adding specific key-value pairs.

      This method appends two headers, "request-header" with the value "added-request" and "c" with "d", while clearing the route cache to ensure the new route is calculated.

      Overrides:
      onRequestHeaders in class ServiceCallout
      Parameters:
      processingResponseBuilder - the builder used to construct the ProcessingResponse.
      headers - the HttpHeaders representing the original request headers.

    • onResponseHeaders

      public void onResponseHeaders(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.ProcessingResponse.Builder processingResponseBuilder, io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HttpHeaders headers)
      Modifies the outgoing response headers by adding new headers and removing existing ones.

      This method appends two headers, "response-header" with the value "added-response" and "c" with "d", while removing the "foo" header. It does not clear the route cache.

      Overrides:
      onResponseHeaders in class ServiceCallout
      Parameters:
      processingResponseBuilder - the builder used to construct the ProcessingResponse.
      headers - the HttpHeaders representing the original response headers.

    • onRequestBody

      public void onRequestBody(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.ProcessingResponse.Builder processingResponseBuilder, io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HttpBody body)
      Handles the request body by appending a custom suffix to the existing body.

      The method appends "-added-body" to the original HTTP request body without clearing it.

      Overrides:
      onRequestBody in class ServiceCallout
      Parameters:
      processingResponseBuilder - the builder used to construct the ProcessingResponse.
      body - the HttpBody object representing the original request body.

    • onResponseBody

      public void onResponseBody(io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.ProcessingResponse.Builder processingResponseBuilder, io.envoyproxy.envoy.service.ext_proc.v3.HttpBody body)
      Handles the response body by replacing it with a static value.

      The method completely replaces the original response body with "body replaced".

      Overrides:
      onResponseBody in class ServiceCallout
      Parameters:
      processingResponseBuilder - the builder used to construct the ProcessingResponse.
      body - the HttpBody object representing the original response body.

    • main

      public static void main(String[] args) throws Exception
      Main method to start the gRPC callout server with a custom configuration using the ServiceCallout.Builder.

      This method initializes the server with default or custom configurations, starts the server, and keeps it running until manually terminated. The server processes incoming gRPC requests for HTTP manipulations.

      Usage:

      
 ServiceCallout.Builder builder = new ServiceCallout.Builder()
     .setIp("111.222.333.444")       // Customize IP
     .setPort(8443)                  // Set the port for secure communication
     .setEnablePlainTextPort(true)   // Enable an plaintext communication port
     .setServerThreadCount(4);       // Set the number of server threads
      Parameters:
      args - Command-line arguments, not used in this implementation.
      Throws:
      Exception - If an error occurs during server startup or shutdown.
